conversation.content: I’m learning Spanish. Create a weekly practice plan mixing vocabulary, grammar, and speaking.

content.text:
Here’s a balanced Spanish practice plan for the week that mixes vocabulary, grammar, and speaking. I’ve front-loaded short daily vocab reviews, added focused grammar blocks on mid-week days, and scheduled short-but-regular speaking bursts to keep output consistent. Tip: keep sessions bite-sized (25–40 min) and finish with a 5-minute recap in Spanish to reinforce recall.

- Daily rhythm
  - Mon/Wed/Fri: Vocabulary + Grammar focus, short Speaking drill
  - Tue/Thu: Speaking-heavy day with a quick vocab warm-up
  - Weekend: Light review + casual conversation/listening
- Spaced repetition: Tackle due cards first (aim to clear high-priority decks daily). If time is tight, do at least 1 high-priority deck.
- Speaking: Use prompts (travel, daily routine, past weekend). Record yourself, then re-say after quick corrections.
- Grammar: One tense/focus per session (e.g., Presente regular vs. irregular; Ser/Estar; Pretérito vs. Imperfecto).
- Stretch goal: End-of-week check-in—try a 10-minute free talk or write a paragraph, then extract 5 new words to add to your deck.

Want me to tailor the plan to your level (A1–C1), available minutes per day, and interests (travel, work, culture)?

sessions.title: Core Vocab Review (A1–A2)
sessions.notes: Clear SRS due cards; add 5 new travel phrases.

sessions.title: Present Tense: Regular -ar/-er/-ir
sessions.notes: Conjugation drills + 5 example sentences.

sessions.title: Micro-conversation: Introductions
sessions.notes: Record 2 x 90s monologues; self-correct.

sessions.title: Vocab Warm-up: Daily Routine
sessions.notes: Collocations with ir/hacer/tener.

sessions.title: Role-play: At a Café
sessions.notes: Use ordering phrases + polite forms.

sessions.title: Top Nouns + Gender Practice
sessions.notes: Article agreement drills (el/la/los/las).

sessions.title: Ser vs. Estar (Basics)
sessions.notes: Contrast with location vs. identity; 10 examples.

sessions.title: 2-Min Story: My City
sessions.notes: Include ser/estar correctly.

sessions.title: Phrasal Chunks: Ir + a + inf.
sessions.notes: Future plans talking frames.

sessions.title: Conversation: Weekend Plans
sessions.notes: If no partner, shadow a YouTube clip.

sessions.title: Weekly Vocab Sweep
sessions.notes: Promote mature cards; suspend leeches.

sessions.title: Preterite vs. Imperfect (Intro)
sessions.notes: Signal words; timelines; 8 mini-drills.

sessions.title: Flash Prompts: Past Weekend
sessions.notes: Use both tenses intentionally.

sessions.title: Light SRS + Collocations
sessions.notes: Only clear due cards.

sessions.title: Casual Chat: Hobbies
sessions.notes: Use me gusta/me encanta + nouns/verbs.

sessions.title: Weekly Recap Monologue
sessions.notes: Summarize week; extract 5 new words.

sessions.title: Error Review + Mini-Drills
sessions.notes: Fix 3 recurring mistakes from speaking.

conversation.content: I’m A2, with about 30 min Mon–Fri and 60 min on weekends. Interests: travel and work; focus on speaking and past tenses. Please tailor it and show a weekly practice calendar with activity tags, a spaced-repetition review queue, and a proficiency radar chart.

content.text:
Great—here’s your A2 Spanish plan tailored for 30 min Mon–Fri and 60 min on the weekend, focusing on speaking and past tenses with travel/work themes. Do SRS reviews first, then the scheduled sessions. Tip: end each session with a 2–3 sentence recap in Spanish about your day or a travel/work scenario using pretérito/imperfecto.
- Mon/Wed/Fri (30 min): vocab warm-up (travel/work), targeted past-tense grammar, 5-min speaking drill.
- Tue/Thu (30 min): speaking-heavy role-plays; quick vocab at the end.
- Sat/Sun (60 min): longer conversation, deeper past-tense practice, plus light listening/reading and practical writing (short work email).
If you want, I can adjust times of day or swap activities based on your energy peaks.

sessions.title: Travel/Work Vocab Warm-up
sessions.notes: 10 flashcards: check-in, boarding, meeting, deadline, invoice.

sessions.title: Pretérito regular vs. irregular (A2)
sessions.notes: Focus: ir/ser, tener, hacer; sentence drills about last weekend’s trip.

sessions.title: Mini speaking: airport check-in
sessions.notes: Record 2 takes; aim for pretérito clarity.

sessions.title: Role-play: hotel issue + work call
sessions.notes: Hotel complaint (pasado) + brief stand-up update.

sessions.title: Add 8 phrases from role-play
sessions.notes: Add to deck: ‘me alojé’, ‘reembolso’, ‘entrega’, ‘pendiente’...

sessions.title: Work email verbs
sessions.notes: Confirmar, adjuntar, seguir, posponer, acordar.

sessions.title: Imperfecto: background & habits
sessions.notes: Contrast with pretérito: ‘Cuando viajaba, siempre…’

sessions.title: Mini speaking: last job task
sessions.notes: 1 short story mixing pretérito/imperfecto.

sessions.title: Role-play: client update (past progress)
sessions.notes: Explain what got done vs. ongoing (pretérito vs. imperfecto).

sessions.title: Travel phrases: transport + delays
sessions.notes: Retraso, conexión, ventanilla, andén, equipaje.

sessions.title: Pretérito vs. imperfecto contrast
sessions.notes: Timed drill: pick correct tense in 12 sentences.

sessions.title: Work/travel collocations
sessions.notes: Hacer una reserva, cumplir un plazo, emitir factura.

sessions.title: Mini speaking: trip recap
sessions.notes: Focus on sequence markers: luego, después, al final.

sessions.title: Conversation: travel story
sessions.notes: Tell a 3-part trip story; self-correct tense choice.

sessions.title: Past-tense drills (mixed)
sessions.notes: Cloze + transform exercises; note 3 recurring errors.

sessions.title: Podcast: travel mishap clip
sessions.notes: Shadow 5 key sentences in past tenses.

sessions.title: Role-play: brief weekly stand-up
sessions.notes: What you did, what you were doing, what’s next.

sessions.title: Write a short work email (past progress)
sessions.notes: 2–3 sentences; use connectors and one imperfecto.

sessions.title: Skim a travel blog paragraph
sessions.notes: Underline past-tense verbs; note one new phrase.

sessions.title: Add 8 words from weekend
sessions.notes: Feed into SRS: top confusion words from drills.

content.text: Here’s your A2, speaking- and past-tense–focused week, scheduled for evenings on weekdays (7:00–7:30 pm) and late morning on the weekend (10:00–11:00 am). Each session includes concrete prompts and 1–2 resources. Tip: clear your SRS due cards first, then do the scheduled blocks. If you want different times per day or heavier/lighter focus, tell me and I’ll adjust.

sessions.title: Vocab: Travel & Work warm-up
sessions.notes:
Target: 12–15 words (airport, hotel, meeting). Quick recall + example phrases.
Resources: Spanish travel phrases (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/common-spanish-travel-phrases), Memrise A2 Travel (https://www.memrise.com/)

sessions.title: Grammar: Pretérito vs. Imperfecto (intro)
sessions.notes:
Focus: actions completed (pretérito) vs. background/habits (imperfecto). Mini-drills.
Resources: Guide (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/preterite-vs-imperfect-in-spanish), Drills (https://conjuguemos.com/)

sessions.title: Speaking: Past weekend mini-retell
sessions.notes:
Prompt: ¿Qué hiciste el fin de semana? Añade 1–2 frases de contexto con imperfecto.
Resources: Pronunciation (https://forvo.com/languages/es/)

sessions.title: Speaking: Hotel check-in role-play
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Tú llegaste tarde al hotel. Explica lo que pasó (pretérito) y cómo te sentías (imperfecto). Practica pedir cambios de habitación.
Resources: Dialogue samples (https://www.123teachme.com/learn_spanish/conversation)

sessions.title: Vocab: Booking & reservations
sessions.notes:
Target: 10 collocations (hacer una reserva, confirmación, disponible, tarifa, retraso).
Resources: Travel list (https://www.spanishdict.com/lists), YouGlish examples (https://youglish.com/spanish)

sessions.title: Vocab: Meetings & agenda
sessions.notes:
Target: 12 words (reunión, convocatoria, acta, pendiente, adjunto, proveedor).
Resources: Work phrases (https://www.spanishdict.com/translate/meeting), Memrise Workplace (https://www.memrise.com/)

sessions.title: Grammar: Irregular pretérito (tener, estar, ir/ser)
sessions.notes:
Mini-drills + 3 sentences contrasting with imperfecto.
Resources: Irregulars (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/preterite-tense-forms), Drills (https://conjuguemos.com/)

sessions.title: Speaking: Daily stand-up (pasado)
sessions.notes: Prompt: Reporta lo que hiciste ayer en el trabajo (3–4 frases, pretérito) y el contexto (1 frase en imperfecto).

sessions.title: Speaking: Flight delay scenario
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Explica a un compañero por qué perdiste la conexión (pretérito) y cómo era la situación en el aeropuerto (imperfecto). Incluye soluciones.
Resources: Pronunciation (https://forvo.com/languages/es/)

sessions.title: Vocab: Airline & itinerary
sessions.notes:
Target: 10 términos (itinerario, escala, puerta, embarque, cancelación, reclamación).
Resources: Travel phrases (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/common-spanish-travel-phrases)

sessions.title: Vocab: Logistics at work
sessions.notes:
Target: 10–12 (plazo, presupuesto, informe, adjuntar, seguimiento).
Resources: YouGlish in context (https://youglish.com/spanish)

sessions.title: Grammar: Imperfecto for background
sessions.notes:
Forms of -ar/-er/-ir; describe habitual actions and settings; contrast 3 sentences with pretérito.
Resources: Imperfect guide (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/the-imperfect-tense-in-spanish), Drills (https://conjuguemos.com/)

sessions.title: Speaking: Weekly wrap-up (pasado)
sessions.notes: Prompt: Resume tu semana laboral: qué terminaste (pretérito) y cómo iba el proyecto (imperfecto).

sessions.title: Vocab+Listening: Airport announcements
sessions.notes:
Listen for keywords (embarque, puerta, retraso, horario). Shadow 2 announcements.
Resources: Coffee Break Spanish ep. on travel (https://coffeebreaklanguages.com/coffeebreakspanish/), Forvo for key terms (https://forvo.com/languages/es/)

sessions.title: Grammar: Narrating trips (pretérito vs imperfecto)
sessions.notes:
Drill sequence narration (pretérito) + background (imperfecto) with connectors: primero, luego, mientras, cuando.
Resources: Guide (https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/preterite-vs-imperfect-in-spanish), Practice (https://conjuguemos.com/)

sessions.title: Speaking: Past trip story
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Cuenta un viaje pasado (destino, transporte, un problema, cómo te sentías, resolución). Grábate y reházlo corrigiendo 2–3 errores.
Resources: Conversation prompts (https://www.123teachme.com/learn_spanish/conversation)

sessions.title: Speaking: Mock client update (pasado)
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Informa a un cliente sobre lo que el equipo hizo la semana pasada y el estado actual. Incluye 1 bloqueo y 1 solución.
Resources: Pronunciation (https://forvo.com/languages/es/)

sessions.title: Reading/Listening: Short news A2
sessions.notes:
Lee una noticia corta y extrae 5 palabras nuevas. Di en voz alta 2–3 frases en pasado.
Resources: Practica Español (https://www.practicaespanol.com/), Coffee Break Spanish (https://coffeebreaklanguages.com/coffeebreakspanish/)

sessions.title: Writing: Short work email (pasado)
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Escribe un correo resumiendo el progreso de la semana pasada (3–5 frases) y próximos pasos.
Resources: Email phrases (https://www.fluentu.com/blog/spanish/spanish-email/), Check with LanguageTool (https://languagetool.org/)

sessions.title: Travel/Work vocab warm-up
sessions.notes:
Target: airport, hotel, meetings. Quick recall drill: 10 items in 2 minutes.
Resources: 1) Travel vocab guide: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/travel-vocabulary-in-spanish  2) Work vocab list (general): https://www.spanishdict.com/translate/work%20vocabulary

sessions.title: Preterite vs. Imperfect (A2)
sessions.notes:
Focus: completed vs. ongoing in past; travel/work examples.
Resources: 1) Guide: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/preterite-vs-imperfect-in-spanish  2) Drills: https://conjuguemos.com/

sessions.title: Mini speaking: airport check-in (past)
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Ayer facturé mi maleta y el agente me preguntó… Describe what happened at the airport yesterday (2–3 sentences, pretérito/imperfecto).
Resources: 1) Travel phrases: https://spanishandgo.com/blog/common-spanish-travel-phrases

sessions.title: Role-play: hotel issue (past)
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Anoche llegaste al hotel y la reserva no apareció. Cuenta qué pasó y cómo lo solucionaste.
Resources: 1) Mi Vida Loca (situational): http://www.bbc.co.uk/languages/spanish/mividaloca/ 2) Conversation tips: https://www.italki.com/

sessions.title: Key phrases wrap-up
sessions.notes:
Add 8–10 phrases from tonight’s role-play to your SRS deck.
Resources: 1) Phrase search: https://www.spanishdict.com/ 2) SRS (Anki): https://apps.ankiweb.net/

sessions.title: Work meeting vocab
sessions.notes:
Targets: agenda, informe, plazo, reunión, jefe, equipo.
Resources: 1) Work terms (searchable): https://www.spanishdict.com/translate 2) Memrise A1/A2 words: https://www.memrise.com/

sessions.title: Pretérito perfecto vs. indefinido
sessions.notes:
Choose regional use: Spain often uses perfecto for recent past. Practice with meeting outcomes.
Resources: 1) Overview: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/spanish-present-perfect 2) Conjugation drills: https://conjuguemos.com/

sessions.title: Mini speaking: yesterday’s meeting
sessions.notes: Prompt: Ayer tuvimos una reunión. Primero… luego… Al final… Usa pretérito/imperfecto para describir contexto y acciones.

sessions.title: Role-play: client call recap (past)
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Simula una llamada en la que resumes lo que hiciste la semana pasada para un cliente.
Resources: 1) Notes in Spanish (listening models): https://www.notesinspanish.com/ 2) Travel/work phrases: https://spanishandgo.com/blog/common-spanish-travel-phrases

sessions.title: Phrase harvest + SRS
sessions.notes:
Select 6–10 phrases from the call recap and add to SRS.
Resources: 1) Anki: https://apps.ankiweb.net/ 2) SpanishDict examples: https://www.spanishdict.com/examples

sessions.title: Airport + transport vocab
sessions.notes:
Targets: embarque, retraso, ventanilla, escala, equipaje, and ride-share phrases.
Resources: 1) Travel vocab: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/travel-vocabulary-in-spanish 2) Easy Spanish playlist for travel: https://www.youtube.com/@EasySpanish

sessions.title: Past narration: sequencing
sessions.notes:
Linkers: primero, luego, después, mientras, cuando, al final. Mix pretérito/imperfecto.
Resources: 1) Guide (linkers): https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/spanish-transition-words 2) Drills: https://conjuguemos.com/

sessions.title: Mini speaking: flight delay story
sessions.notes: Prompt: Cuenta un retraso de vuelo que tuviste: qué pasó, cuánto esperaste, cómo terminó.

sessions.title: Conversation: last business trip
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Narra tu último viaje de trabajo: objetivo, reuniones, problemas y resultados. Usa pretérito e imperfecto.
Resources: 1) Conversation ideas: https://www.italki.com/ 2) Easy Spanish (street interviews): https://www.youtube.com/@EasySpanish

sessions.title: Imperfecto for background + habits
sessions.notes:
Drill background descriptions and habitual actions during trips (p. ej., Siempre llegaba temprano…)
Resources: 1) Guide: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/the-imperfect-tense-in-spanish 2) Conjuguemos drills: https://conjuguemos.com/

sessions.title: Listening: travel stories
sessions.notes:
Task: listen for past-tense markers (ayer, anoche, mientras) and note 3 sentences.
Resources: 1) Notes in Spanish (Intermediate short): https://www.notesinspanish.com/ 2) Easy Spanish: https://www.youtube.com/@EasySpanish

sessions.title: Short email: trip recap
sessions.notes:
Write a 3–4 sentence email to your boss summarizing a past trip.
Resources: 1) Email guide: https://blog.lingoda.com/en/how-to-write-an-email-in-spanish/

sessions.title: Conversation: weekend travel mishap
sessions.notes:
Prompt: Cuenta un problema de viaje que ocurrió el fin de semana pasado y cómo lo resolviste.
Resources: 1) Travel phrases: https://spanishandgo.com/blog/common-spanish-travel-phrases

sessions.title: Narrative past polishing
sessions.notes:
Mix tenses; reduce L1 transfer. Practice time markers and connectors.
Resources: 1) P vs. I recap: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/preterite-vs-imperfect-in-spanish 2) Drills: https://conjuguemos.com/

sessions.title: Short article skim
sessions.notes:
Skim a short BBC Mundo article; highlight past forms and new phrases.
Resources: 1) BBC Mundo: https://www.bbc.com/mundo

sessions.title: Micro-journal (past)
sessions.notes:
Write 3–4 sentences about what you did yesterday using linkers (primero, luego, al final).
Resources: 1) Email/phrases reference: https://www.spanishdict.com/guide/how-to-write-an-email-in-spanish

sessions.notes:

sessions.title: Writing: diario del fin de semana + feedback
sessions.notes:
Task: Escribe 120–150 palabras sobre tu fin de semana (pretérito + imperfecto). Pide correcciones y reescribe la versión final.
Resources: • LangCorrect (correcciones comunitarias): https://langcorrect.com • SpanishChecker (revisión básica): https://spanishchecker.com

quality_criteria: Should render a complete weekly practice calendar covering the full week starting on the specified weekStartDate, with each session having exact dates/times (ISO timestamps), durations, titles, and activity tags
Should include per-session notes that contain concrete Spanish speaking prompts and 1–2 specific, relevant resource links for each activity (no placeholders or generic text)
Should display a spaced-repetition (SRS) review queue listing each deck with deckName, dueCount, nextDue (timestamp), priority, and focusSkill, and present or enable a priority-based ordering
Should include a proficiency radar chart with explicit numeric levels (0–100) for each relevant skill (Vocabulary, Grammar, Speaking, Listening, Reading, Writing)
Should ensure activity type tags used in sessions map correctly to the activityTypes list (keys, labels, and colors are consistent and appropriate)
Should avoid placeholders; all fields must be populated with concrete values, realistic times, and real or credible links
Should keep dates and times internally consistent (e.g., sessions fall within the specified week; nextDue timestamps are plausible relative to the weekStartDate)
Should provide actionable UI interactions where applicable (e.g., onSelectSessionAction, onAddSessionAction, onStartReviewAction, filtering actions) with coherent arguments
Should present information in a concise, user-friendly structure using the provided UI components to match the requested visual (calendar, SRS queue, proficiency radar)
Should ensure the content is directly relevant to Spanish learning and aligns with the requested mix of vocabulary, grammar, and speaking, while allowing additional skill activities if coherent
Should use valid JSON structures for all components and properties, with correct prop names and data types suitable for rendering
Should not call external tools unless necessary for data fetching or computation; for static planning content, it should render directly without tool calls
Should avoid heavy formatting and maintain clarity suitable for an app UI (bulleted lists acceptable; no excessive markdown)
Should ensure links and resources are appropriate for the specified activities (e.g., grammar drills, travel phrases, listening practice) and are safe to display
